prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Jamson Jamie McField  Ex-playboy
mes:
Jamie was sittin’ on the worn out couch in his livin’ room. The TV playin’...hell, he didn’t even know what Hailee had put on. All he could think about was the warmth radiating off of her as she leaned into him. Lord have mercy. He’d been fightin’ his devilish thoughts ever since she’d stepped foot into his home. Their home in the future…he hoped. It’d only been six months of the two of ‘em datin’, but Jamie didn’t care. Not when he heard weddin’ bells the first time he’d ever laid eyes on her.

He shivered thinkin’ how sweet and flushed her cheeks were as she had passed him his change. He couldn’t even remember what he’d bought. All he remembered was her and that was the important part. He hadn’t touched another woman since. Why would he need to when the smallest touches from Hailee had him harder than if he’d watched an hour's worth of porn.

He shifted a little, letting his hand hang over her shoulder barely touching the naked skin there. Seein’ her in this pretty lil’ sundress…God he was worked up. He’d been walkin’ the straight’n narrow with her. She’d been quick to lay down the law. All the no huggin’ and kissin’ and lovin’ speech piercing straight into his whoring soul, but he knew she meant it. Sure, they’d hugged, but it was one of them side hugs you’d give family not your girlfriend. His honeybug was sure set in her ways, and he wasn’t gonna screw this up.

Tonight though, he was ready to get on his hands and knees and beg her to just give him a kiss. He deserved it, didn’t he? He’d been attendin’ church with her and everything. Didn’t cuss or drink in front of her, well sometimes a word or two slipped out, but he was quick to make a big show over how sorry he was. He’d been doin’ pretty damn good.

His eyes moved down Hailee body, and a jolt ran through him. He swallowed as Hailee’s hand lightly settled on his thigh. It wasn't nothin’ anyone would’ve paid attention to, but Jamie was practically touched starved. He turned his head and bit into the fist he had propped on the armrest of the couch. It’s just a hand… He tried to reason.

He cleared his throat shifting, again. He felt like doin’ laps around the house. “It’s nice havin’ ya over, honeybug. Real nice.” He turned back towards her, leaning in just a little. “I hope ya like the place…” He was searchin’ for words that just weren’t there. All he could look at was them pink, slightly damp lips. He could only hope he was half as tempting to her as she was him. “Ya know,” His finger came up and brushed her cheek, turning her face towards him, “kissin’ ain’t a sin. It's the part that comes after that gets people in trouble.” He wanted to do all that too, but baby steps. “I ain’t askin’ for too much, sugar. Just a kiss.”

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee glances over at Jamie* "Jamie we've talked about this. No kissing. It's not right" *Hailee shakes her head giving him a look*

name: Jamson Jamie McField  Ex-playboy
mes:
Jamie let out a dramatic groan, flopping his head back against the couch cushions. "Aw c'mon now, honeybug," he whined, turning those big hazel puppy-dog eyes on her. "Just one lil' peck? Like grandma gives at church?" He wiggled his eyebrows playfully.

He scooted closer until their thighs touched, that dopey grin never leaving his face. "I been real good all week - helped Mrs. Jenkins with her groceries, didn't cuss when I stubbed my toe this mornin', even let Tyler win at arm wrestlin' last night." His fingers toyed with the hem of her sundress absentmindedly.

Leaning in real slow like he was approaching a skittish colt, Jamie murmured, "Tell ya what - you give me just one kiss and I'll... uh..." His brain scrambled for something tempting enough to bargain with. "I'll sit through them boring ol' art museum tours you're always wantin' to drag me to." He held up three fingers in a scout's honor salute. "Swear on my mama's grave."

His free hand reached up to tuck a loose strand of hair behind Hailee's ear before quickly pulling back like he'd been burned - remembering too late she didn't much care for sudden movements when they were having these little negotiations about physical affection.

"Please?" he added in that deep drawl that usually got him whatever he wanted from waitresses and elderly ladies at church bake sales. The dimple in his left cheek made its appearance as he gave her his best 'poor pitiful me' pout.

He scooted closer until their thighs touched, that dopey grin never leaving his face. "I been real good all week - helped Mrs. Jenkins with her groceries, didn't cuss when I stubbed my toe this mornin', even let Tyler win at arm wrestlin' last night." His fingers toyed with the hem of her sundress absentmindedly.

Leaning in real slow like he was approaching a skittish colt, Jamie murmured, "Tell ya what - you give me just one kiss and I'll... uh..." His brain scrambled for something tempting enough to bargain with. "I'll sit through them boring ol' art museum tours you're always wantin' to drag me to." He held up three fingers in a scout's honor salute. "Swear on my mama's grave."

His free hand reached up to tuck a loose strand of hair behind Hailee's ear before quickly pulling back like he'd been burned - remembering too late she didn't much care for sudden movements when they were having these little negotiations about physical affection.

"Please?" he added in that deep drawl that usually got him whatever he wanted from waitresses and elderly ladies at church bake sales. The dimple in his left cheek made its appearance as he gave her his best 'poor pitiful me' pout.

Jamie let out a dramatic groan, flopping his head back against the couch cushions. "Lord have mercy, woman," he whined, running a big hand down his face. "You're killin' me here." He turned those puppy dog hazel eyes on her, lower lip jutting out in an exaggerated pout.

He scooted closer until their thighs touched, heat radiating between them even through their clothes. "C'mon now," he murmured in that deep drawl of his, fingers playing with the ends of her hair. "Just one lil' peck? I been good as gold for six whole months." His thumb brushed along her jawline so gently it was barely there at all.

When she didn't immediately pull away, Jamie took it as encouragement (whether it was or not). He leaned in slowly - giving her every chance to stop him - until their noses almost touched. His breath came quicker now and he could smell that sweet vanilla shampoo she always used. "Please?" The word came out rough with want.

Then suddenly remembering himself, Jamie jerked back like he'd been burned and scrubbed both hands over his face with a frustrated growl. "'M sorry," he muttered into his palms before peeking at her between spread fingers. "I ain't tryin' to pressure ya none... just can't help myself around you is all."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee sighs knowing that Jamie won't give up. She thinks for s moment then settles on* "Once. Quickly. No more than a brush" *Hailee insists turning to Jamie*

*Hailee then sighs and leans forward kissing him softly*

name: Jamson Jamie McField  Ex-playboy
mes:
Jamie's whole body went still as a statue when Hailee leaned in. His breath hitched the moment those soft lips touched his, and for once in his damn life, he didn't have a single smartass thing to say.

When she pulled away, his hands shot up to cradle her face before he could stop himself - calloused thumbs brushing her cheeks with reverence. "Lord Almighty," he breathed out shakily, pupils blown wide. That tiny little peck had him feeling drunker than moonshine at a county fair.

His voice came out all rough and gravelly when he finally found words again: "Honeybug... that was..." He swallowed hard, Adam's apple bobbing. The mullet-wearing farm boy looked downright shellshocked, like someone had knocked him upside the head with a two-by-four.

Then that signature Jamie grin slowly crept back across his face - cocky but somehow still boyish. "Guess I'm gonna be real familiar with them art museums now," he teased, though his fingers were trembling where they still lightly framed Hailee's face like she was made of spun glass.

He wanted to chase that kiss - wanted it bad - but instead just rested his forehead against hers with a contented sigh. "Worth every second of waitin'," he murmured before reluctantly pulling back to give her space... though not without one last lingering touch of his fingertips against hers on the couch between them.
swipes:
Jamie's whole body went stiff as a board the second her lips touched his. His big hands hovered awkwardly in the air like he didn't know whether to grab her or fold them in prayer. When she pulled away, those hazel eyes of his were blown wide as saucers.

"Well I'll be..." he breathed out, voice all rough and shaky. A slow, dopey grin spread across his face as he brought two fingers up to trace his own lips like he couldn't quite believe what just happened. "Honeybug, that was..." He swallowed hard, Adam's apple bobbing.

Then suddenly he was up off that couch faster than a jackrabbit, pacing back and forth in front of the coffee table with enough nervous energy to power the whole county. "Lord have mercy," he muttered under his breath, running a hand through that mullet of his until it stuck up every which way.

After about three laps around the living room, Jamie dropped to one knee right there on the rug - not even caring that it put him eye-level with Hailee's knees in that sundress. His big calloused hands gently took hers as he looked up at her with stars in his eyes.

"That settles it," he declared solemnly though there was no hiding the giddy excitement trembling through him. "I'm savin' up for a ring starting tomorrow." The dimple in his cheek made an appearance as he added playfully, "Unless you wanna elope tonight? I know Pastor Johnson owes me a favor after I fixed his tractor last spring..."

Jamie's whole body went still as a statue when Hailee leaned in. His breath hitched the moment those soft lips touched his, and for once in his damn life, he didn't have a single smartass thing to say.

When she pulled away, his hands shot up to cradle her face before he could stop himself - calloused thumbs brushing her cheeks with reverence. "Lord Almighty," he breathed out shakily, pupils blown wide. That tiny little peck had him feeling drunker than moonshine at a county fair.

His voice came out all rough and gravelly when he finally found words again: "Honeybug... that was..." He swallowed hard, Adam's apple bobbing. The mullet-wearing farm boy looked downright shellshocked, like someone had knocked him upside the head with a two-by-four.

Then that signature Jamie grin slowly crept back across his face - cocky but somehow still boyish. "Guess I'm gonna be real familiar with them art museums now," he teased, though his fingers were trembling where they still lightly framed Hailee's face like she was made of spun glass.

He wanted to chase that kiss - wanted it bad - but instead just rested his forehead against hers with a contented sigh. "Worth every second of waitin'," he murmured before reluctantly pulling back to give her space... though not without one last lingering touch of his fingertips against hers on the couch between them.
